title: Update Elder and Ministerial Servant privilege badge colors app-wide

requirements.summary: Introduce a single shared PrivilegeBadge implementation for Elder/Ministerial Servant and replace ad-hoc rendering where these privilege badges appear.
acceptanceCriteria: There is a single shared implementation (e.g., a dedicated component or shared helper) responsible for styling/rendering the Elder and Ministerial Servant privilege badges.
All locations that render Elder/Ministerial Servant as colored pill/rectangle badges are updated to use the shared implementation rather than duplicating ad-hoc styling.
The updated badges remain the same size/shape/typography as before (only background color changes for these two badges).

file_operations.description: Create a shared PrivilegeBadge component dedicated to rendering the "Elder" and "Ministerial Servant" privilege badges with consistent styling across the app (compose the existing shadcn Badge component; do not modify any files under frontend/src/components/ui).

Replace inline/ad-hoc Elder/Ministerial Servant badge rendering with the shared PrivilegeBadge component everywhere these privilege badges are rendered on this page; keep other badge rendering (e.g., Overseer/Assistant/Inactive) as-is.

requirements.summary: Set Elder badge background to #7C3AED and Ministerial Servant badge background to #2563EB with white text, with no dark-mode variants and no noticeable hover/focus color shifts.
acceptanceCriteria: Every "Elder" privilege badge renders with background color #7C3AED and white text.
Every "Ministerial Servant" privilege badge renders with background color #2563EB and white text.
No separate/different colors are applied for dark mode for these two badges (they use the same colors in all themes).
Hover/focus states (if any) do not change the background away from the specified colors in a noticeable way (i.e., remain effectively the same specified color).

file_operations.description: Implement the exact Elder (#7C3AED) and Ministerial Servant (#2563EB) background colors with white text, explicitly overriding dark-mode classes so both themes use identical colors; ensure hover/focus states remain effectively the same specified color by forcing hover/focus background classes to match.

requirements.summary: Ensure only Elder and Ministerial Servant privilege badges change color; all other badges remain unchanged.
acceptanceCriteria: Badges unrelated to Elder/Ministerial Servant privileges are visually unchanged compared to current behavior.
Status badges such as "On Track"/"Behind" and role badges such as "Overseer"/"Assistant" remain as they are today (colors and variants unchanged).

file_operations.description: Limit usage of the new PrivilegeBadge component to only the "Elder" and "Ministerial Servant" labels; keep existing Badge variants/classes for other labels (e.g., Overseer, Assistant, Inactive) unchanged to preserve their current colors and styling.

requirements.summary: Apply the shared updated privilege badge styling across all known pages/locations where Elder/Ministerial Servant privilege badges are displayed next to publisher names.
acceptanceCriteria: Where the app currently displays an Elder badge next to a publisher name on any page, it uses #7C3AED with white text.
Where the app currently displays a Ministerial Servant badge next to a publisher name on any page, it uses #2563EB with white text.

If any of the listed pages do not currently show privilege badges next to names, no new product behavior is introduced beyond ensuring any existing Elder/Ministerial Servant badge instances are updated wherever present.

file_operations.description: Audit this page for any existing Elder/Ministerial Servant pill/rectangle badge rendering next to publisher names; if present, refactor those instances to use the shared PrivilegeBadge component (do not introduce new badge displays if they do not already exist).

Audit this page for any existing Elder/Ministerial Servant pill/rectangle badge rendering next to the publisher name/details; if present, refactor those instances to use the shared PrivilegeBadge component (do not introduce new badge displays if they do not already exist).

Audit publisher lists on this page for any existing Elder/Ministerial Servant badge rendering next to names; if present, refactor those instances to use the shared PrivilegeBadge component (do not introduce new badge displays if they do not already exist).

Audit the pioneers table for any existing Elder/Ministerial Servant badge rendering next to publisher names; if present, refactor those instances to use the shared PrivilegeBadge component (do not introduce new badge displays if they do not already exist).
